facts.fact: Water covers about 71% of the Earth's surface.
facts.detail: Most of this water is found in oceans, ice caps, and glaciers.

facts.fact: The human body is about 60% water.
facts.detail: Water is essential for various bodily functions, including digestion, temperature regulation, and waste removal.
It can dissolve more substances than any other liquid, making it essential for life and many industrial processes.
Only about 2.5% of the Earth's water is freshwater, and much of it is locked in ice caps and glaciers.
